meanings.sent1: The bivariate graph displayed the relationship between height and weight.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted a bivariate study to analyze the impact of temperature and humidity.
meanings.sent3: The bivariate experiment with cats wearing hats and dogs in clogs was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her bivariate approach to gardening, considering both sunlight and soil quality, yielded beautiful results.
meanings.sent5: The bivariate nature of the puzzle, requiring both logic and creativity, made it challenging.

meanings.definition: Relating to a statistical analysis that involves two variables.
meanings.sent1: The bivariate regression model examined the relationship between income and education level.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used bivariate analysis to understand the correlation between age and income.
meanings.sent3: The bivariate comparison of ice cream flavors and weather patterns was surprisingly insightful.
meanings.sent4: Her bivariate interpretation of the data, considering both time and cost, provided valuable insights.
meanings.sent5: The bivariate nature of the study, looking at both height and weight, revealed interesting patterns.
